instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 video problem
threads.message:
Arrived with no liquid damage or visible damage on board. Completely black screen  on internal screen and when plugged into external only half the image appears see attached picture. Tried known good screen but still black 

what should be checked first??

threads.title: 820-00840 video problem
threads.message:
Do PRAM reset 2-3 times.
Test again external video, disconnecting LCD assembly.

threads.title: 820-00840 video problem
threads.message:
No changes after pram reset. Still no backlight or image on internal. External still half black as in picture. Tested with LCD assembly disconnected

Apple diagnostic says there may be a issue with the display VFD001

What next?

threads.title: 820-00840 video problem
threads.message: After login the 1/2 black screen disappears and the whole screen shows normally on external

threads.title: 820-00840 video problem
threads.message:
Still nothing on internal LCD, inside macOS?

Do you get 3V3/5V_S0SW_LCD at least in the first few seconds, when chime?
If not check disconnecting internal LCD.
If yes, DP_INT_HPD should go high at same time; ONLY with LCD connected.
